# The `unique_function` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unique-function">unique&#95;function</a> is a type-erasing functor similar to std::function. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;typename FunctionT&gt;
class llvm::unique_function&lt;FunctionT&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unique-function">unique&#95;function</a> is a type-erasing functor similar to std::function.

It can hold move-only function objects, like lambdas capturing unique&#95;ptrs. Accordingly, it is movable but not copyable.

It supports const-qualification:
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unique-function">unique&#95;function&lt;int() const&gt;</a> has a const operator(). It can only hold functions which themselves have a const operator().</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unique-function">unique&#95;function&lt;int()&gt;</a> has a non-const operator(). It can hold functions with a non-const operator(), like mutable lambdas.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 57 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/functionextras-h">FunctionExtras.h</a>.
